name: Sultan Gardens Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Returned this morning from Sultan Gardens and having read 100's of the reviews before going it took myself and partner a while to work out why we believe some people don't rate this as a 5* hotel. I shall try to be as honest as possible in this review as if the management takes the time to read all the reviews (which he obviously does) then i believe they are trying to make improvements wherever possible.
reviews.title: Thinking of going here - read on ....

likes.disliked: — Smelt very slightly damp - think due to the shower curtain.

reviews.text: So here goes:- If you are looking for an equivalent of a top 5* hotel in London then I honestly don't think you will find it anywhere in Egypt - due only because of the size of the complexes - not the service or establishment. This hotel, i believe, is without a doubt worth it's 5*, it is however very big ... but then anyone looking at this hotel will know that with it's 4 swimming pools, wellness center, etc.
reviews.title: great holiday!

likes.liked: — it was clean, staff were friendly and the pools were great.

reviews.text: On ARRIVAL
reviews.title: Excellent Resort
Fantastic holiday at the Sultan Gardens!
reviews.text: Our baggage was taken from us, we reported to reception - which was immaculate and greeted with a smile at reception - we were then given our arm band a welcome envelope (interery) and key.
OUR ROOM
reviews.title: fantastic service and value for money

reviews.text: Me and my family always said we wouldn't go to the same hotel ever.. but it all changed when we stayed at Sultan Gardens Resort... we have now been to Sultan gardens resort three times and will most definitely be returning again this year! I cannot explain how friendly and helpful every single one of the sultan gardens members of staff are, they would stop whatever they are doing to help you and they are always smiling and saying hello to you.... as soon as you arrive you are made extremely welcome.. staying at sultan gardens has been the best holiday for me my family and friends and we never want to go anywhere else..the animation team are just amazing, before we stayed at sultan gardens my sister (8) would not talk to anyone, she was so shy and since then she has so much more confidence and it is down to them completely! the animation team are more than just the animation team to us they are our best-est friends ever and we look forward to seeing them very soon, as long with all of the other members of staff at sultan gardens that are also our very best friends... the rooms are also wonderful, and cleaned everyday by extremely friendly men that clean the room from top to bottom, you cannot fault anything at this hotel! and If you do go to sultan gardens more than once it is amazing how much they remember you without you having to say "we've been here before" that is how much the staff care and look after everyone! it is truly a 5* in every single way possible for every single family!
reviews.title: Best holiday ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Annabel and family...
reviews.title: Lived up to expectations!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my first visit to Egypt, and I chose Sultan Gardens based on the positive reviews on here, and the very competitive price offered.
reviews.title: Sultan Gardens excellent Hotel.

reviews.text: For the price, I had realistic expectations of what the experience would be, so I wasn't disappointed - in fact my partner and I had a wonderful time and really enjoyed our holiday. I was expecting a good British 3* standard and I'd say that's about right, but with some elements that raised the bar - in particular the customer service which was excellent.
reviews.title: The perfect winter getaway!

reviews.text: A few specifics - the weather was beautiful every day, but there were some cooler days with quite strong wind when we went (16th - 23rd Feb), which made it a little chilly at times. You can create a wind block with sun beds on the beach, but I would recommend bringing some warmer clothes. In the evenings it was cooler, and I'd recommend a jumper or a light jacket, particularly if you are going to sit outside.
reviews.title: Fab stay... Exceeded expectations

reviews.text: We have just returned from a week's holiday at the Sultan Gardens Resort and we wish we had booked for longer. We will do next time.
reviews.title: Great holiday, would recommend and go back!

reviews.text: We only booked for a week as we have a 20 month old child and we thought if the food wasn't up to much and he wouldn't eat it, then we would struggle to feed him for any longer than a week. We worried for nothing, he ate all the food and was happy to do so. The waiters are very good with small children and give them lots of attention, which of course they love. The food choice catered for everyone and had a good selection on each day. It was a little bland at times, but was always hot and well presented. I didn't hear of anyone being ill and all the restaurant and serving areas were kept clean.
reviews.title: Fabulous holiday!

reviews.text: We were in the 100's block, which was perfect location for us. We were in the middle of the heated pool and the 2 main pools and the restaurant. This meant that our baby monitor worked and we could leave our little one in his cot when he was asleep and go out to dinner on our own each evening. We also managed to get an hour or so by the pool on our own when he had his daily nap. If he woke up, we were literally a minute from the room.
reviews.title: Just gets better and better each time !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has 4 pools, with bars at each, 2 are heated in winter and were a lovely 28 degrees. Not all hotels in the area have heated pools and this was a must for us.
reviews.title: GOOD VALUE FOR MONEY

reviews.text: The hotel is directly next too the Sea Breeze and Sea Magic hotels, with the Rotana just a little further along. There is not alot outside the hotel, other than a little supermarket and a couple of shops. However, the hotel has a good and reliable taxi service which can take you to Na'ama Bay, Soho Square or anywhere else you want to go.
reviews.title: Highly Recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I do not normally do all inclusives, preferring to opt for independent travel. Now I know why. What you get promised is not what you get in reality. We booked a week in this resort through Travel Republic and paid an extra 100 pounds to get what we were told was a "superior double". When we got to the hotel we were told there was no such thing as a superior double and in fact all the rooms were the same. When we saw the room it was actually two twin beds in a reasonable but quite outdated room. When questioned, the reception staff merely advised us to "push the beds together". We were also promised an airport pick up which never materialised, neither did it happen on the way back, instead we had to pay for a taxi to get our flight. Also we were led to believe our package inclused use of more than one restaurant as well as other leisure facilities. Actually we were only permitted to use the Italian restaurant twice with what we had paid and the rest of the time had to eat in the main buffet canteen restaurant.
reviews.title: Misleading and disappointing

reviews.text: There was nothing wrong with the hotel itself, even though parts are a bit scruffy and old. It was clean, had four glorious pools, the food was okay by Egyptian standards and the hotel staff such as porters, cleaners and waiters were exceptionally friendly. Those in reception were not.
reviews.title: Highly Recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So, make sure when you book that you double and triple check what you have paid for. And even then do not expect it all when you arrive! Then you may not be disappointed.
reviews.title: Great winter holiday .

reviews.text: T
reviews.title: Brilliant Value for Money

reviews.text: We stayed at the Sultan Gardens in December 2011 and really enjoyed ourselves. The hotel was clean, service was excellent and the food was good. The complex is quite large and we got lost a couple of times but it was quite funny as we met other people who were lost at the same time. I would highly recommend this hotel for a nice relaxing break in the sun.
reviews.title: An excellent spot for a winter sun break with a family!

reviews.text: I am very late in writting this but we have had the pleasure of holidaying at this beautiful hotel twice this year!in February and June.
reviews.title: Number 1 for us in Sharm !

reviews.text: From the moment you arrive at the airport and are greeted by someone from the with the hotel courtesy bus you are extremely well looked after.This is a very nice touch not offered by other hotels!,
reviews.title: Great holiday for any group!

reviews.text: What stands out about this hotel above others is its attention to customer care,any problem is handled very well and taken seriously.I must thank Mr Abdullah again for taking great care in looking for my lost cardigan!
reviews.title: Fantastic week with family

likes.disliked: — The 2 largest pools were too cold for young children

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are very spacious,and everywhere around the hotel grounds are very well kept.The food is plentiful and varied.
reviews.title: Good Hotel,but with a few exceptions

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are hoping to return again in February 2009 !!
reviews.title: not a good five star hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is excellent value for money, very clean throughout. the staff are very friendly and helpful. Excellent location, snorkelling on the hotel beach is excellent, better then the boat trip we went on.
reviews.title: good value all inclusive

reviews.text: We had an issue with the first room we were allocated but were moved immiedatley with no fuss, some of the blocks have not yet been reenovated and these rooms are really dated, but the updated rooms are fantastic!
reviews.title: great staff

reviews.text: The food is of good quality, plenty of chioce althouh I felt the hot food was a bit limited at times, food on the beach bar was a bonus too! we ate her most lunch times.
reviews.title: WOW, WOW, WOW!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The entertainment team are excellent and work very hard day and night, they put on a variety on activites, but don't hastle you if you don't want to participate. The evening shows they put on are really funny. We went in march and it can be rather chilli in the evening so jacket definitely needed.
reviews.title: Boring two weeks

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only critisim is related to the water, you get 1 bottle of water in your room each day, and then further glasses of water are available from dispensers throughout the hotel , they are usually covered and the one I did see uncovered worried me and I would not drink from them after that and preferred to drink the bottled water, but if want a second bottle you have to pay for it, although it is only a pound. I did have a dodgy tummy whilst away which i put down to drinking from the water dispensers the first few days. Although I know it could be anything that caused it, my partner did not use water dispensers and he was fine
reviews.title: Noisy & a little tired

reviews.text: Myself, husband and 8 year old daughter holidayed at the Sultan Gardens from 26th August to 2nd September, this was our 3rd trip to Sharm and we have also been to Taba and Marsa Alam.
reviews.title: A nice break

reviews.text: I had spoken with Basel on several occasions and arranged an airport transfer. Unfortunately the transfer didn’t arrive for some time I had to call the hotel and we had to wait a fair old while. On arrival we were checked in quickly and taken by taf taf to our room in block 200, our requests were more or less met although maybe a bit nearer the beach would have been better. The room was large, clean and good air con , fridge , bottle of water daily ( but plenty of water machines around the complex) tea and coffee making facilities, nice bathroom with bath and also hair dryer and toiletries and robes.
reviews.title: Sultans ruled Egypt, however has Gardens had its day ?.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food – breakfast is buffet style and was very good , egg station etc , my daughter loved the pancakes – it was always very very busy at breakfast even at 7.15am maybe this is due to travelling in high season but I personally like a quiet breakfast - no chance ! Lunch you had a choice of the buffet, pool bar , fish restaurant ( pay extra )and beach bar, dinner was buffet style or the Italian or fish restaurant ( pay extra ) apparently you can book the Italian twice in your weekly stay, we eventually managed to book our reservation on our second day and only got one booking for our last night. When we went for dinner there it was quite nice but nothing amazing and I am sure they could have got more people in, it was pretty quiet ! Food on the whole at the Sultan Gardens was fine you won’t starve and it was always hot and fresh but by the end of the week as you’d expect with AI it was becoming a bit repetitive. There is also room service and this was quite reasonably priced and looked a nice menu although we didn’t try it. At breakfast you had to pay for orange juice this seems the norm in Egypt but also if you wanted fruit this was for sale – I was VERY disappointed in this and have never experienced this before.
reviews.title: Nice & Relaxing holiday at Sultan Gardens

reviews.text: Drinks – lager was fine, Rose wine was fine as was vodka and tonic and water we tended to stick to these. One thing that did annoy us and I have emailed Basel since my return is that staff were serving alcohol to children.
reviews.title: An enjoyable stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service and staff – this was mixed some staff were lovely happy and smiley and happy to help, others were positively miserable and would make you wait for no good reason, I appreciate it was Ramadan but I’m, afraid that shouldn’t impose on peoples holidays. Some of the pool bar staff were very off hand and also some of the shop keepers – the shops were quite nice, some stuff reasonably priced and others outrageous.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: date :22nd june 2008
reviews.title: brilliant hotel
Loved the animation team.
reviews.text: j&D - ireland

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and i stayed at this hotel from 4th - 11th june 2008.We had a fantastic holiday, so good that we never left the hotel except to go to the beach.We found the food, rooms and staff fantastic especially Ehab and Mamoud at pool bar no. 1.They were polite , friendly and extremely helpful, we didnt even have to get off our sunbeds to get a drink,they brought it to us.Beach was fabulous, no problems getting beds and umbrellas , no matter what time we went.The same applied to the pool.Room was clean and spacious with plenty of little extras.We definitely will be returning in April and will be bringing the kids.My only problem was booking the transfer from the airport on arrival as i couldnt the e-mail address .
reviews.title: Excellent value

likes.disliked: — The beach is not too far away but it is a bit of a trek back up the hill

reviews.text: I loved our experience in sharm.
reviews.title: feeling special

likes.liked: — in the middle of the beach and central facilities

reviews.text: Sultan gardens is a great resort. We were on a all inclusive for 2weeks.
reviews.title: nice hotel

likes.disliked: — plug facilities for kettle and coffee and tea had to be phoned to housekeeping if required stocking

reviews.text: I went for a week all inclusive and had heard really mixed reviews about Egypt hotels, so was apprehensive, and was expecting a 3 star hotel rather than the advertised 5 star. We flew with Thomas Cook from manchester which was fine, although were seated in row 40 both ways (the back row) where the seats don't go back so it was a bit cramped. The pick up from the airport was smooth (you don't need a visa by the way if you are staying in Sharm for your entire holiday - the rep who meets you will give you more info) and the hotel upgraded our room to a sea view at the request of our travel agent on our booking form. All the staff were helpful, friendly, and there were plenty of them. They appreciate tips and you making an effort to say please and thank you. This might sound obvious, but lots of people didn't. There were lots of Brits at the hotel, as well as Russians (but so what?!)
reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised

likes.liked: — Plenty of friendly staff and the views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall the hotel was great - clean room, clean communal areas, 4 good pools (plenty of sunbeds at that time of year), great beach and snorkelling, enough sunbeds on the beach when we were there (not even early in the morning), good selection of food and drink, good atmosphere. My friend had prickly heat and the on site pharmacy were really helpful. I had a massage but they did the wrong one (they did back and I had wanted full body), so asked me to come back the next day for another one for free. The only annoyance was that there is a free shuttle bus into Naama bay 2x a day and we tried to book on the evening one unsuccessfully - you have to do it in person at 8am (not by phone as I was told by one person on reception) - but be there by 750am if you want to get on it - there is also no reserve list, which would seem sensible. We never managed to get on it (although there were places on the daytime bus)!
reviews.title: Nice hotel getting better all the time

likes.liked: — very clean, friendly staff and good food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can't comment on the entertainment, as we didn't use it, but for a weeks relaxing holiday, it was perfect, and I would definitely go back.
reviews.title: The Friendly Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had 10 days at this hotel during November and in the main I can only give positive feedback. The hotel staff were very friendly and while it is not 5* by our standards it was still excellent. The food is very good considering the number of people that are catered for every day. It is not like eating at home which I see as a positive. For those who don't like to go without burgers and chips this kind of food is available every day at the pools bars.
reviews.title: Great hotel, ok food

reviews.text: In addition to the main restaurant there is an Italian which is nice, but be warned they serve you very quickly as they do in the fish restrauant. This is because there are a lot of Russians at the hotel who want everything yesterday. Just let the staff know that you don't want to be too rushed. We had one not so nice meal in the fish restrauant but we let the staff know and they could not apologise enough - to the extent that we were offered a complementary meal (you pay an additional charge to eat at the sea food restaurant). We could not take this as we were going home the next day so instead we had a complimentary bottle of wine and basket of fruit delivered to the room.
reviews.title: Top Stay at the S.G.R

likes.liked: — the sea view from my room
likes.disliked: — the next door hotel building work making a racket...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a great relaxing holiday.Very clean resort.The staff are wonderful nothing is any trouble. Will definitely go back.Only money we spent was on tips to staff and they were worth it.We had beautiful weather,went snorkelling which was fantastic the colours and variety of fish is amazing! You can't help but enjoy this place!
reviews.title: fantastic

reviews.text: Booked the hotel through travel republic for a very good price.
reviews.title: It's all about the Staff...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Emailed the hotel for a transfer from the airport and requested a sea view. They provided both of these, Check in was very quick. Excellent service
reviews.title: Staff and Management Brilliant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ROOMS - the rooms are in need of a little TLC but thats only a minor thing as they are always kept clean with linen, towels, bath robes changed everyday. Bathroom has a hair dryer and toiletries and always has plenty of loo roll and hot water for a shower. The rooms have air con, very comfy beds, tv, roomy wardrobe, fridge and a kettle. Great view from the balcony of tiran island.
reviews.title: Superb value, fantastic staff, great holiday!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: FOOD AND DRINK - Food is good, a great variety of food for every meal. The fresh bread and cakes are out of this world. It can get busy at peak times and the russians are rude. We found going to the Dana resturant above the main resturant was a bit quiter and easier to get to the food. The italian is inculded in the all inc and is of high quality you can book this at the main resturant. There are snacks provided at the pool bar most of the day to so you can never go hungry. Local spirits do have an after taste but drinkable. Beer is good. Soft drinks are pepsi and lemonade and the juices for breakfast are great just wish i could of had a big glass!!!! There are 5 bars all with nice relaxing atomsphere, sometimes a little music would of been nice but again this is a minor thing.
reviews.title: Great week at Sultan Gardens

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having had some less than favourable experiences in Egypt in hotels advertised as 5 star, we have just returned from this hotel and can say it is the best hotel and resort we have been to. Make sure you book the free courtesy bus to pick you up from the airport otherwise you may be fleeced for £30 for a taxi. Upon arrival you are met with suited bellboys who take charge of your luggage. You are then escorted to checkin and offered a choice of refreshments.
reviews.title: truly a 5 star hotel and resort in every way

reviews.text: All the staff from managers to recerptionists,the animation team, chefs, cleaners, security on the beach were exemplary in their manners and willingness to assist and all seemed genuinely happy in their work.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.text: The food was second to none. Truly 5 star restaurant quality. We were all inclusive (at a very reasonable rate) and ate sometimes in the main restaurant and sometimes in the Italian restaurant. You are entitled to two meals in the waiter served Italian, where we enjoyed the most delicious steaks one evening and seafood on the other. Two other restaurants including Cajun and a fish restaurant were also available at extra cost.
reviews.title: Fantastic first time in Sharm at The Sultan Gardens :)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You have the choice of a room, suite or villa. As there were only the two of us we booked a room which was spacious and (as all the accommodation) overlooked the beach. The room was meticulously cleaned everyday and sheets changed mid week.We were in room 233 which was next to the children s pool and the outdoor evening entertainment which although it finished at 10.30 was rather noisy when we had decided on an early night or watching a film. We would choose a room nearer the beach next time. There were tea and coffee making facilities in the room and satellite TV with an enormous choice of films in English and others in French and Russian.
reviews.title: Loved It

reviews.text: The hotel is placed within a huge complex (compared to nearby hotels which seem to be squashed into small spaces.) There were activities like yoga, salsa and many others for the adults and a kids club and children s activities too. There was a separate pool for children so as we were on our own we chose the pool labelled (quiet area) or the fabulous beach which was truly a huge expanse with complimentary beds and parasols, beach activities, volley ball, boules etc. snorkling, diving club, boat trips. Watch out for the purple jelly fish tho. They did clear them from the central part of the beach so you could swim and paddle.
reviews.title: coming back

reviews.text: This was our third time (I think it was the best one) in Sultan Gardens and we had absolutely fantastic time. We stayed from 22 to 29th of March, 2012 and there was six of us in our party: myself, my partner and our 1 year old daughter and my parents with my brother and sister. Before our trip I emailed the hotel to request two rooms on the ground floor in the block 800 and to arrange airport transfer. I got a very prompt reply from Mr Ihab (hotel manager) and he explained to me the lay out of this block of rooms and was very kind to meet all my requests, even upgrading my parents from family room to falimy suite, just so the both of our rooms could be on the ground floor! This type of customer service makes this hotel to stand out from the rest of them and makes you want to come back again and again.
reviews.title: Consistently good!

reviews.text: We arrived after 10pm and were picked up by hotel's minibus and 10 minutes later we were at reception checking in, which took less than 5 minutes, and they left the restaurant open for us, so we could have a dinner, which was a really nice touch, especially after a 5.5 hours flight with a 1 year old baby :) After a quick dinner we were brought to our lovely rooms, both rooms were refurbished, very clean, spacious and had everything you would want in your holiday room. I think the location of block 800 is very good as it is very close to all the pools and restaurants, and it is a short walk to the beach and not too close to amphitheatre as we didn't want any noise from the shows in the evening. We had requested a baby cot in our room and it was there when we arrived.
reviews.title: can not wait to return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am not going to go on for ages :) I just want to say that food was fabulous in all the restaurants we ate, plentiful, always hot and always good selection. In one of the recent reviews someone said that food in Iberostar Varadero in Cuba was much better, I would strongly disagree as we stayed there before and I thought that selection was quiet poor. We did the kitchen tour and it is amazing how well organized their kitchen is, it wasnt a bit hectic but well laid out and very calm and very very clean. Especially if you think about the amount of people they have to cater every day for, I think the hotel has the capacity of 1000 people and we were told that they go through 3000 eggs a day! I was a bit doubtious about the lamb as I read ages ago in one of the reviews that there is no lamb in Egypt and that it is very expensive to import, so I asked about it on the tour and was shown a big leg of Australian lamb :) Drinks were good, they are locally produced but we liked them: beer, wine, g&t and etc.
reviews.title: Excellent - Friendly - Clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff, as mentioned in many reviews, are so hard working, professional and very attentive to any needs of guests: from reception, to the bar and restaurants, animation, pool attendants and etc everyone was very good and nothing was ever too much trouble!
reviews.title: Brilliant Hotel - Excellent Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We never had any trouble with sunloungers: by the pools or on the beach, but we did spend most of the time on the beach. We found a really nice quiet area by the left wall if you are facing the sea, most of the days we were the only people in that beach area with loads of free loungers around. It really suited us as it was nice and quiet and my daughter enjoyed her naps with a sea breeze and I enjoyed the amazing snorkelling, which was much better than off the main pontoon, there was much more fish and coral seemed to be alive in our "private beach" area and to get into the deep water there is a concrete blocks path.
reviews.title: Good value for money

reviews.text: We found the staff very helpfull and friendly,our waiter remembered our drink order after one night!There was no hints for a tip.There were plenty of staff to accomodate you.
reviews.title: definately one not to miss!!

reviews.text: We found the food to be of a very high standard,with plenty of choice.The staff would cook a dish for you if required even if it is not on the menu,to accomodate the non adventurous tourist!
reviews.title: Simply the best.. better than all the rest!

reviews.text: The rooms were large with good views and well stocked.They were cleaned daily and to a high standard.Nothing was too much trouble.
reviews.title: WOW !!!!
Almost Exceeded our expectations!
reviews.text: There was plenty available for the active person if thats required or you could enjoy a relaxing time by one of 4 pools on a very comfortable sunbed!
Sequrity was not an issue as there was somebody on the gate at all times.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel- well recommended for families with children
Good hotel and value for money
reviews.text: Stayed at the hotel from 21 to 28 Dec. The hotel is very well run although some of the service requests were slow this is Egypt and everything is slow. Food was very good always something to eat and the soups were lovely and a great variety of breads. Of the 2 heated pools one was mainly for children and had a water slide and the other was quieter both very clean and always sunbeds. The staff are what make this hotel, very friendly and helpful. Rooms are ok could do with a bit of updating we had a room facing the beach which was nice. The whole of the resort is very clean and the staff work very hard to keep it that way. Russians were not a big problem some of them were rude but then so are some English and the Italians can be quite rude. Even though the hotel was full they was no excessive noise at night and no English louts. Would return again.

reviews.title: Loved the place
reviews.text: We went to the resort for Christmas and New year, the cleanliness and the staff were great we could not fault the service and friendliness of the them, they could not have been more helpful. Our room was kept very clean and the linen and towels were spotless. The Gala nights for Christmas Eve and New Years Eve were spectacular. We would recommend this hotel as a great place to stay families, couples and even singles would enjoy it. The food was also very good and there was a variety of it.

reviews.title: Loved Sultan Gardens
reviews.text: Just got back from 10 days at Sultan Gardens. Had a wonderful time. The hotel was beautiful, especially the pool areas and the lovely beach. We were so impressed with how friendly and helpful the staff were. The Christmas Eve Gala dinner was fantastic, such a lot of effort went into presentation, food and entertainment. The only things I would say is that the entertainment wasn't particularly good and the two large pools were far too cold to swim in. But we would definitely recommend this hotel and Sharm El Sheikh as a resort. Make sure you go quad biking, para-sailing, snorkelling, camel riding and star gazing. These were all incredibly fun and interesting trips. Would also recommend going to Naama Bay for a night out as it has a really vibrant atmosphere. Thank you for a great holiday!

reviews.title: Fantastic value for money
reviews.text: I stayed here with my sister 8th-22nd December 2008.

reviews.title: the must have holiday
reviews.text: First, I really can't believe all the last reviewer said. I wonder if she was actually at the same hotel we were.

We stayed at Sultan Gardens for 11 nights and had a fab time,after reading some reviews on this site we contacted Basel at the hotel and he arranged transport for our party from the airport which was waiting for us when we arrived.Reception staff were very helpful and when we asked to change rooms there was no problems.the food at this hotel was fab if you are a picky eater come here as there was always something nice to eat.
reviews.title: happy holidays

reviews.text: Ive got to give a special mention to the waiters in the restaurant Ali and Mostaffa were great apart from doing their jobs they were friendly and had us laughing every time we were in there .
reviews.title: Very Family friendly Resort, always wanting to improve

reviews.text: The hotel is in the middle of no where but the hotel will get you taxi to Namma bay which costs about 90 Egyptian pounds.
reviews.title: great hotel, great service,great people

reviews.text: The hotel grounds are big and the swimming pools are massive and there was never a problem getting a sunbed the towel guys were always on hand to help you ,the pool bars serve food at dinner time so if you didn`t want to leave the sun you didn`t have to the guys in pool bar were OK (could be a bit friendlier).
reviews.title: A Fantastic Hotel but need to sort AI Policy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the beach is OK its down a hill and some steps and there is plenty of sunbeds and it has a floating jetty over the coral .which leads me to the snorkeling its a must the fish are amazing.
reviews.title: Nice but not 5 star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here last year with my girlfriend. We won't be going back, though it's not terrible just average.
reviews.title: Average all inclusive, but very busy, food not so good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was poor to average, albeit the only other all inclusive I've stayed at was the Iberostar in Varadero Cuba, where the food was very good. Others don't seem to mind it, but we expect much better.
reviews.title: Brilliant !!!

reviews.text: The room was basic but clean and had a nice view of the sea and island across the sure, we were happy with the accommodation. Asking and tipping the cleaner for extra water ensured we had a good supply going forward.
reviews.title: Sultan Gardens Good Value but don't expect 5 star

reviews.text: The resort looked to be at capacity, and was very busy - it was difficult to get beach seats in the morning (but plenty in the afternoon) and pool seats at anytime. Fortunately on the second or third day they opened the upstairs restaurant which made dining a lot less of a pain/mad rush/noisy.
reviews.title: Second Time round and still brilliant !!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unfortunately, without being Xenophobic, the Russian visitors are, in the main, brash, rude, and loud. The staff mostly have glum faces until they realise you're not Russian, and treat you a little better - the Russians treat them with rudeness and contempt, so I can't blame them really.
reviews.title: 5 star all inclusive?...you're joking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I have just returned from a 10 day holiday at Sultan Gardens Resort. Although I did email ahead I didn't get the refurbished room or the view I asked for, but having said that we still had a fab time. The food was always hot and you would have to be the fussiest person on this earth if you couldn't find something you liked. We had a junior suite which was very spacious. The air con was quiet and worked well, we asked for softer pillows which were sorted the same day, towels and sheets were lovely and white and were changed daily. There is a little bus which runs all day from reception to the beach if anyone has walking difficulties, but we walked up and down each day. As previous reviews have said the staff here are a joy to be around. You are invited to join in activities but the animation team do not pressure at all. There is something for everyone to do or take part in at The Sultan Gardens, you can do as much or as little as you want. I wouldn'y say it is a 5 star hotel but it's the best we have been to in Egypt and we can't wait to go back.
reviews.title: Will definately return

reviews.text: Just returned from our second visit to Sultan Gardens. Had a lovely time, the weather was perfect. We found the food to be better than last year and it showed on the scales on our return!! 4lbs on in one week!! Basil just would like you to know that your staff are a real credit to you...I would like to give a mention to Mohamed at the beach bar, always a smile on his face especially when he recognised us from last year! He walks the beach from one end to another giving people drinks and doesnt expect any tips. Ahmed from the pool bar, and the entertainment team too many to name but must say Tanya, Dylan,Bob and Irina always worked soooooo hard and still had time to chat to us every day. Thanks everyone for a great holiday....we will be back!!
reviews.title: Return to Sultan Gardens
Value for Money.
reviews.text: Value for what we paid but not quit what we expected looking at all the five star reviews,we stayed in a refurbish room over looking the sea lovely except for the large tree right out side the window my wife also question me over the room and was I sure it had been refurbed.
On the up side the staff are A1 they made our stay first class.
reviews.title: fabulous

reviews.text: But over all maybe we where looking for more than what we found.
reviews.title: We'll be going back for a third time!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in Sultan Gardens Hotel from 8th -15th of June and we had an absolutely fabulous time. It was our fifth time in Egypt as we come here every year in the second week of June to celebrate our own and my parents wedding anniversary. Last year we stayed in Hilton Sharks Bay and although our stay there was very pleasant, we were very disappointed with their house reef as the corals were mostly dead and there wasn’t much fish in the sea :) So this year after reading a huge amount of reviews on tripadvisor.com we decided to book Sultan Gardens hotel. Prior to our tip I e-mailed Basel to arrange airport transfers and as we were coming to celebrate a special occasion I asked him for two rooms with nice views. He replied promptly and confirmed our airport transfer time and he assured me that two very nice rooms were reserved for us. It was so great to hear it and immediately it put us into holiday mood :) On Sunday the 8th of June we flew from Dublin to Sharm el Sheikh with Futura Airlines-the worst flight ever and even worse on the way back. We were delayed by two hours so we landed at 02:30 instead of 00:30. Twenty minutes later we were outside of the airport and the first thing we saw – was a board with our names :) A short ride on the air-conditioned bus and we were in the hotel. Receptionist was very efficient and he did smile (just some previous reviews mentioned that reception guys never smiled) and five minutes later we were on the way to our room no 657. Somewhere between Dublin and Sharm el Sheikh my husband managed to loose little keys from our suitcase and I was panicking that we won’t be able to open it. We mentioned it when we were checking in and we were told that within 5 min somebody will be in our room to help us (and that was 3 o’clock in the morning). From the moment we saw our room we understood what a great present Basel gave us- we were upgraded to junior suite with a beautiful sea view, my parents were upgraded as well and they were staying in no 659. Few minutes later we heard a knock on the door – it was one of the maintenance guys to help us to unlock the suitcase and it only took him a minute to do it. And after such a long day we were fast asleep with smiles on our faces as we were so happy to be back in Egypt. Next day we started with a fantastic breakfast, there was a great selection of food and yes, toaster machine was a bit slow, but we weren’t exactly rushing anywhere :) All our big family really enjoys snorkelling and that’s one of the main reasons we come to Sharm el Sheikh every year, so after breakfast it was time to check out Sultan Gardens house reef. We had no problems founding 6 sun beds and umbrella and that was around 10 o’clock in the morning. The sand on the beach is not as fine as you will find in the Caribbean countries but it was much nicer comparing to other resorts in Sharm el Sheikh. To enter deep water you can use either plastic pontoon or two paths made out of blocks. Wow, what a variety of fish and corals we saw under the water. Most of the coral reef is still alive and boasting with the variety of colours and shapes. Let me just tell you that last year we went to Ras Muhammed for a day trip and we were supposed to see all the amazing corals and fish but the under water life is ten times better in Sultan Gardens. We had lunch in the main restaurant and afternoon we spent lazing around pools, again we didn’t have any problems with sun beds. It does get a little bit hectic in the main restaurant at dinner time but only because second floor restaurant is being renovated at the moment. But even at that we never had any problems finding big table for us. All the staff work so hard and still find a minute to talk to customers and smile. We especially enjoyed the service of Abu Rahman as he always made us laugh and he was very kind to my little sister. As regards to the quality and variety of food we can honestly say that Sultan Gardens has the best of both. We travel a lot – Caribbean, America, Asia, Europe but food in Egypt could never compare to any of these countries, it never tasted as good and was mostly bland and tasteless. Normally in any hotel in Sharm el Sheikh we’ve been before (we only do all inclusive) you would walk into the restaurant and you see a huge amount of food but you could easily walk out hungry after the meal as beef was tough, chicken was dry, vegetables – tasteless and etc. It is a completely different story in Sultan Gardens, although you might think that selection of food is not great (which is absolutely not the case), because of the layout of the restaurant, you are sure to find that every dish tastes fantastic, is hot and plentiful. Lamb stew, BBQ beef, chicken curry, fish, vegetables, fresh pasta are only some of the dishes we enjoyed. During lunch and dinner we always found two types of soup, diet corner with steamed veg, rice, chicken or fish and great selection of desserts and fresh fruit. Let me just tell you that watermelon at lunch time was to die for, so sweet and crunchy As soon as a tray of food was getting empty it was replenished straight away. In some other hotels we witnessed (especially at dinner time) how people were killing each other for that last piece of chicken or meat on the tray and then the empty tray was sitting there for 10-15 min and then as soon as people saw a new tray coming they would jump and push other people just to get there first so that made dinners more like hunting championshipAt the time of our stay Sultan Gardens was completely full but even at that there was enough of food for everyone. My husband recognised Muhammed- one of the restaurant managers from Tropicana Grand Oasis (we stayed there 3 years ago) and he was very kind to send 2 fruit platters to our rooms. I know it’s a small thing, but small things like that make your holiday so much more enjoyable. Few times we had lunch around the pool or on the beach and it was really good as well. We tried Italian restaurant for dinner as well, food there was very good and we didn’t find service to be slow but on the opposite to be very efficient. During our stay we mostly drank beer, red wine and soft drinks, all of them of a good quality; soft drinks are poured out of the cans or plastic bottles, not out of a dispensing machine and are all branded – so it’s a proper Pepsi, Schweppes tonic, 7up and etc., which is great. You get one 1.5l bottle of still water per room per day and during the day you can get water out of dispensing machine per glass in any bar or restaurant. One thing I really liked in Hilton Sharks Bay last year – around the pools, beach, all walking paths they had small coolers stocked up with 0.5l bottles of still water, so you could grab one as you were walking around or just lazing by the pool or beach. I would like to mention again that all staff work really hard, Mustaffa- he cleaned our room and done an amazing job every day, animation team – was fantastic, evening shows were great and during the day they provided great entertainment. Judging by the amount of kids on stage at kids disco I can only assume what a great job girls at kids club do. We went on a trip to Tiran Island by speed boat; we booked it through one of the guys on the beach. As there were six of us he didn’t put anyone else with us on the same boat, so it was more like a private trip which was amazing. We didn’t see turtles but really enjoyed a spin and snorkelling of the island. What we loved as well about this hotel- the international mix of people: there was an equal mix of Russians, English, Italians, French, Polish, Slovakians and etc.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel, fantastic holiday!

reviews.text: Overall we had such a fantastic time that we are still raving about it to all our friends. For us it is THE number ONE hotel in Sharm el Sheikh and we can’t wait to come back next year. And we better book it soon as we were told it is completely booked out until November. This hotel deserves its high rating and should be number one in tripadvisor. The main thing to remember – don’t have your expectations to high and you will be amazed with the quality of service, food, accommodation and entertainment. At the end of the day don’t expect this hotel to be Four Seasons but for the price you pay –you get an absolutely amazing deal. We booked it through lastminute.com and I think it was only £308 for one week for two of us! And we would like to say a big-big THANK YOU to Basel and all his team for doing such a great job and making our holiday so special. And we are definitely coming back :)
reviews.title: Fantasic Value for Money

reviews.text: We have just returned from a fantastic 10 day break at the Sultan Gardens and were hard pressed to fault it. Of course if you looked hard enough you could find a few areas with room for improvement but overall it was superb value for money.
reviews.title: Very Good resort and excellent Staff

likes.disliked: — Had to share the resort with Russians

reviews.title: fantastic hotel
reviews.text: The slection of food was really good and you could always find something to suit your taste. The service in all resturants was very good.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were very clean and clean towels every day was a nice touch. We stayed in rooms 166 and 168, super views.
reviews.title: Our return to paradise, Sultan Gardens rules OK !!

likes.liked: — good food, clean and tidy areas, good spacious accommodation, friendly helpful staff.

reviews.text: After a dissapointing holiday back in August 2008 at the Sol Y Mar Sharming Inn and had already booked to come to the Sultan Gardens resort in December,I was not looking forward to returning to Egypt,but this hotel as restored my confidence,the staff were really freindly,the food was good,a choice of a main restuarant or italian restuarant( which you had to book in advance)there was always something there you could eat and it was cooked well(no Phaoroes revenge)the drinks were plentiful,Beer,wines,spirites,cocktails,soft drinks,snacks during the day either using the main restuarant or the italian which did pizzas,Lasagne,speghetti and pasta with sauces or the pool bar which did little hamburgers,fish,chicken in breadcrumbs,chips and salads and filled rolls(the choice altered daily at the pool bar)nothing was to much trouble for the staff,if you ordered drinks they would bring to were you was sitting or laying around the pool,they had four pools,two of which was heated, we had a suite which consisted of a double bedroom with safe,a bath/shower room with hairdryer and a living room with a settee which converted to a double bed a breakfast bar with tea and coffee making facilities and satalite t.v.The Gala dinner they laid on at Christmas Eve was the best I had ever seen the food was superb,they had erected this massive Marquee with over a 100 tables all decorated, the chairs were all covered in white satin covers,I have never seen anything like it(except for weddings)they had live music throughout the night.A great experience
reviews.title: Christmas Holiday

likes.disliked: — the room could be a bit brighter at night

reviews.text: We booked a 2 week stay from 2-16 Dec 08 in the Sultan Gardens along with our twin boys aged 11. Overall, holiday was pleasant.
reviews.title: Good and Bad

reviews.text: RUSSIANS
reviews.title: Loved the Sunshine

reviews.text: I do need to mention them first as having read all the reviews before going travelling, I did think that surely they were an exaggeration!!!!!! Oh, how wrong-they were all true and more!!! I have never encountered such rude people (obviously not all, but the majority of them). No please or thank you, no waiting to get to the bar, no waiting to get to the food and the rest you will find out for yourselves when you get to Egypt!).
reviews.title: Good all rounder

likes.disliked: — no tea coffee making facilities in room, but not too much of an issue as not far to walk to main hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ALL INCLUSIVE
reviews.title: Excellent holiday in Sharm

reviews.text: We are a party of 5 (3 kiddies, 9 ,9 ,and 7) and have just spent two weeks at this fabulous hotel, Flew back on the 10/09/09
reviews.title: Probably the best relaxing holiday we have ever had

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort is massive with large pools, kidies slide, immaculate gardens and spotlessly clean public areas.
reviews.title: Not as good as you expect

reviews.text: We stayed in a family room which had a view of the sea and pools 2 and 3. The room itself had a separate double bedroom for the adults, with the kiddies beds being in the main part of the room. Each room had a tv and an independent air conditioning unit. These rooms were also kept spotlessly clean on a daily basis.
reviews.title: great diving

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I think what makes this place so special is the extremely hard working, polite and friendly staff from the cleaners, gardeners, waiters to the chefs and by no means last, the owner Basel. A little thanks by the way of a small tip goes along way but by not giving one would certainly not affect the service you are given / offered.
reviews.title: AWFUL FOOD-A REAL DISAPPOINTMENT

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would like to thank numerous people but can't remember all the names (Sorry!) except for Ahmed Bawdy (top man and i will send you the photos), mohammed Hosny, very poite and helpful, the guy around pool 1 who used to supply me with the water pipes and of course ''minnie mouse'' who runs the kids club and has the patience of a saint (our Emily, Jack and Ben will miss you very much).
reviews.title: Resort of the flies

reviews.text: My wife, twin boys (21 months) and I stayed at this hotel for 2 weeks at the start of December.
reviews.title: Fantastic value and great staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Previously have been to the Baron Palms Resort and Hilton Waterfalls, both in Sharm.
reviews.title: Would we recommend it ? Yes we would !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unless you're going to stay in the heart of Na'ma Bay in one of the more expensive hotels, then you're always going to end up in a remote hotel, situated in a huge private estate full of other remote hotels. You're not going to get town-life outside of the door and you should go expecting an all inclusive, self-contained hotel, that we didn't leave for the whole 2 weeks.
reviews.title: Excellent service superb staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were very comfortable. If you have a young family would recommend you call in advance and book a suite. Our suite had a separate bedroom then a lounge area with two cots in, which, separated by two thick wooden doors meant a good night's sleep every night. :)
reviews.title: wonderfull holiday

reviews.text: I really couldn't fault the hotel, but if you are in a wheelchair or infirm (or have triplets), bear in mind it's built on a slope. Although there's a bus that takes you around the resort every 15-20 mins, you would be much better off in a 'flat' resort like the Baron Palms resort (or in that area, as it's all flat).
reviews.title: good resort but not all inclusive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent a really enjoyable fortnight at the Sultan Gardens recently (early December) and would thoroughly recommend it. However, you need to set realistic expectations before going! We’ve never been on a package holiday before, so can’t compare it to Turkey, Spain or Greece. However, we have also been in the hospitality industry for most of our careers, so like to think we know a thing or 2 about hotels, food and service. We wanted to chill out, not worry about anything and get some winter sun – and Sultan Gardens did not disappoint. The 2 of us paid less than £700 for 2 weeks, all inclusive – tremendous value, but don’t expect the beach to be like those in the Maldives (which we overheard someone complaining about) or the rooms to be like the Dorchester. If Sultan Gardens were a singer, it would be Barry Manilow – professional, a bit dated, not terribly cool; but entertaining and you can’t help loving it! We shall definitely be returning.
reviews.title: Wonderful staff and a great place to chill out
FIRST CLASS STAFF
reviews.text: This review has turned into a bit of an epic, so I’ve included some tips at the end for those of you who don’t want to trawl through the whole lot!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: LOCATION – Close to the airport (10-15 minutes), though we weren’t disturbed by plane noise. If you want to be close to shops, bars and nightclubs, this is not the place for you – try Naama Bay instead. There is building work going on on either side of the hotel, but it didn’t disturb us.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel with friendly staff, lovely pools, nice food a great time had.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ROOM – we were upgraded to a junior suite which was a mixed blessing. As it was just the 2 of us, the extra space wasn’t necessary, but the location was good as we were close to the restaurant and quiet pool. However, we didn’t have a sea view which would have been lovely. Sea view rooms are smaller, close to the noisier pool and the beach, and quite a walk to the restaurant. So it depends on your priorities, really. The room was simply furnished, but very comfortable and the housekeeping staff excellent. We did notice that refurbishments were being carried out. We paid an extra US$50 to keep the room till 4pm, which meant we could sunbathe till 2pm, have lunch, shower, check out and still have a couple of beers before leaving.
reviews.title: Fab Hotel with excellent staff and great weather

reviews.text: WEATHER – fantastic. High 20’s every day and only one day was overcast. Needed an extra layer at night and would recommend long trousers if sitting outside in the evening as there were one or two mozzies (but none in room).
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel and excellent staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from having 2 wonderful hot and sunny weeks in Sultan Gardens.Booked with QWERTY travel and were met at the airport on arrival . The reception staff were so helpful and fixed us up with a room with a sea view as arranged . The hotel complex is vast and situated on a sharp incline down to the beach . Being partially disabled my first impression was how will I manage all these steps to the main restaurant ? but my mind was soon put at ease when I realised a small bus runs around the complex from 08.00 to 20.00 every day, if out of these hours all you needed was to phone 26 and it would be there in minutes . The room we had was excellent and cleaned with fresh linen every day. Plenty of english speaking tv channels if needed . The restaurant staff and food was 100% perfect. Everybody employed there are so polite and helpful,what more can any body want . Egypt being a country that expects tipping I thought it very wise to take 1$ bills with me ,they are worth about 60pence and are I think very reasonable as a little thankyou for whoever I wished earned it . In doing this I can assure you that I was treated like royalty and various staff gave me the name as the Presidente. I would say the staff from the bottom of the ladder to the top all deserve a very good thankyou and I will definately be returning. Thanks for a very relaxing and enjoyable holiday .Sorry I cannot comment on the entertainment as we didn't attend but I am sure they made a good job of it.By the way take a snorkel and water shoes it is a sight worth seeing . Nothing to do or go outside the hotel only flattened Sinai desert no where to have a stroll . Only set back for me was 50 steps down to the beach which has no toilets so if I went there I could not climb up again more than once a day because of my motability so I more went to the quiet pool for comfort . I had no nasty tummy bugs at all and onlydrank bottled water as advised. My comment is give it a try and take 1 dollar bills for that little bit extra.
reviews.title: I was treated like I was royalty by all staff !

reviews.text: I have just returned from The Sultan Gardens (10th Dec - 17th Dec) I went with 2 friends and we have a great time the weather was fantastic, didn't expect it to be as hot as it was, in the high 80's, the hotel was lovely and the staff couldn't do enough for you they were all so pleasant and helpful. The view from our room was great we had a sea view room,every morning we got to see the sunrise. Mohammed the guy who looked after us at pool 1 was great always willing to help. This was a heated pool which was 1 of 5 pools. the rooms were very comfortable and we had tea/coffee facilities in our room which was ideal if your a early riser. The main restaraunt was buffet and the had a theme nearly every night, pleanty of choice for all to choose from, again all the waiters were very hepful and they remembered you and what you had to drink. The beach was nice and the small jetty was ideal for looking at the beautiful tropical fish, you could hire snorkel equipment and just get in the water to see all the coral and fish. We went out on a speed boat to Tiran Island and went snorkeling there it was great and not too expensive. Because the hotel is set on different levels it would not be very good for people with walking diffuculties as there are steps down to the rooms and the beach, they do have a bus called the Taftaf which goes around the complex to pick up and drop off this runs all day until around 10 at night. There was plenty of space and seating areas to relax and chill out. Only 1 dissapointment was the Casa Mia Italian rest...not very impressed with it and would not recommend it, other an that it was a great place and it was only 5 minutes from the airport...would definitley return there again. If you upgrade for around 12 Euros you can get little extras and if you pay around 26 Euros you get unlimited internet access, fully stocked mini bar in yiour room and other items.
reviews.title: Wonderful holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second trip to Sharm and to be honest we were impressed with our hotel last time (Three Corners), but this hotel blew this one out of the sky. After a very boozy plane journey we arrived at Sultan Gardens. From the off I was impressed. After getting our bags taken to our room we hit the restaurant. The food the whole holiday is fantastic. The different theme nights split the holiday perfectly. Obviously the food won't suite everyone, but my partner is quite a particular eater and she had no problems. To be honest I made a pig off myself at every opportunity. The all inclusive larger is nice so that was a bonus, the spirits did make me laugh just at the copied names; Gordons Gin - Gordoons Egyptian Gin. Jonny Walker Whiskey - John Warden Whiskey. To be honest they all tasted the same. And be carefull on the wine its quite strong.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel and Brilliant Holiday

reviews.text: The hotel itself is always immaculate, our room was suprisingly big and was cleaned to perfection every day. The staff in the hotel are fantastic, although I have to mention the staff in the restaurant who work so hard it is unbeleivable. The only issue with staff I had was from the Health Centre, the chap trying to get us to have a massage wasn't impressed when we said we weren't interested. But that is the only complaint I had. The on sight Gym was fantastic and is included in your All Inclusive.
reviews.title: Diving and the beach on the Red Sea

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What impressed me was the entertainment, compared to last year it was 100% better, I enjoyed it all. The Egyptian Dance show, and Fire show are a must. Also, they do a Michael Jackson night which was fantastic. The Animiation team work very hard and they do there best to befriend you and make you feel welcome. I was surpirse to see one of them was Welsh, Leo. It was great to have a member of staff you could have some good craic with. Oh and the Karakoe night is an experience in itself. Although we did win it the night we were on, so if anyone can remember Jackson and Tracey and there rendition of "Don't go breaking my Heat" that was us. The Russians are hillarious to watch. I am sure they are all fitted with there own built in Ipods as they don't dance to the songs that are playing live.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, but please turn down the music.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a nice relaxing break at the SG. As mentioned earlier if you want an all action holiday you may want to go somewhere else but if you want to just chill you cant go wrong here.
reviews.title: Very Good But Not 5 Star

reviews.text: We never made it to the pool until around 11.30am and never managed to get a sunbed all week so we went to the beach every day as beds became available usually early afternoon and the nice breeze kept you cooler. We never saw the policy of not reserving sunbeds with your towels enforced.
reviews.title: Dissaponted!

reviews.text: The staff are very friendly and well trained, they could not do enough for you.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.text: Even though both my wife and I got the dreaded tummy bug even though we were careful what we ate and drank I have to say the food was good if a little bland sometimes with plenty of choice.There was always something on that we both liked. On our first night there they had nicely cooked steak on which was very good. We also enjoyed the Italian restaurant which you have to book
reviews.title: Great Hotel!!!

likes.disliked: — Warm Beer & Wine, Sometimes cold food, Broken Slide by pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The spirits were just ok, but the beer (lager) was very dissapointing. It was on draught and if you are used to premium beers like stella, heineken, carlsberg export or similar you will dissapoined as it reminded me of the 2% stuff you can get in Asda at 4 tinnies for 99p (very fizzy) You could drink it all day and not feel tipsy.
reviews.title: Wish we were still there

aka: Sultan Gardens Hotel Sharm El Sheikh
description: Enviably located just 5 km from the international airport, the Sultan Gardens Resort offers superb accommodation in the heart of one of the most popular resort destinations in Egypt. The resort boasts 220 meters of private sandy beaches, and is nestled between the seas and the beautiful mountain ranges of South Sinai. This resort has all the amenities you would expect of 5* resort including water-sports, live entertainment, fine dining, and easy access to local nightlife.The resort boasts 520 spacious rooms, suite and villas, newly refurbished and brimming with modern comfort. All rooms feature a private balcony or terrace with sea, pool or garden view. Smoking and non-smoking rooms are available.When it comes to recreation and entertainment The Sultan Gardens Resort offers a wide variety of choices. There are four large outdoor swimming pools, two of which are heated, as well as a professional diving center, a variety of water sports from windsurfing to jet skiing, basketball, volleyball and foot ball courts, kid's club with jungle gym, two tennis courts, a squash court, an eighteen hole mini golf course and a fully equipped health club and spa.There is also a hotel singer and a team of professional animators who entertain you throughout the day and put on nightly entertainment in our outdoor Roman style Amphitheatre.In Addition, the resort offers you same day laundry service and 24 hours room service. All rooms come equipped with digital safe boxes free of charge as well as high speed internet access ports, satellite television, individually controlled air condition, mini-fridge and direct dial telephone with long distance calling.
